metadata.synopsis: Right before Karlach's recruitment Wyl recognizes her as the target Mizora gave to him. It will be up to the player to avoid the confrontation with her. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Xh6W54Z2kT7NfVgxgmED_3BD2sbbs62vjFxXMYfMGgc/edit?pli=1#bookmark=id.y05ljfyxmujl
metadata.how_to_trigger: Have Wyll in your party and speak with Karlach during her recruimtent.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Well, well, well. How the Blade of Frontiers has changed.

263.speaker: Karlach
263.text: I thought you hunted devils, Wyll. Not innocents. Were all those people in the druid's grove monsters? Or is the only monster you?

227.speaker: Wyll
227.text: Karlach. Advocatus diaboli. I won't be lectured on monsters by Zariel's servant.

178.speaker: Wyll
178.text: What happened in the grove was a horror - one I won't ignore. But nor will I let a devil roam the Coast unchallenged.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: Please. The only devils here are you lot.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: Wyll, do what you came here to do. End this devil.

73.speaker: Wyll
73.text: Aye. Your reign of horror is over, Karlach.

10.speaker: Karlach
10.text: It's an honour to end the fucker who killed all those people - all those innocent people. You monster.
10.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Listen, it was all a misunderstanding. We didn't mean for them to die.

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: You're not the worst liar I've ever met. But you're daft as a brick if you think I'm going to believe that.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: Those people in the grove weren't what they seemed. They were agents of evil.

181.speaker: Karlach
181.text: That's a load of shit. But you know what? Vengeance can wait. And I have other priorities today.

72.speaker: Karlach
72.text: Tsk. That was pathetic - it really was. How said that shitty lie will be the last thing you say. Bye, fucker. You too, Blade.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: If Wyll is wrong about you, prove it. Lay down your weapon, and we will too.

116.speaker: Karlach
116.text: You'd like that, wouldn't you? Set down my blade and watch as you plunge yours in my heart. Not a chance. I intend to live - over your dead body.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: If you value your life, you'll stand down.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: Argh! You back away first, all right? One false move, and you're dead. I've more important things to do today than kill a rat.

261.speaker: Karlach
261.text: Get the fuck out of here. Now. Before I change my mind.

129.speaker: Karlach
129.text: As for the Blade of Frontiers - you fashion yourself a hero, but you lie down with dogs like this. That's just pathetic.

154.speaker: Karlach
154.text: Oh, I want to live. Just not in a world with you in it.
154.context: NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: We don't have to explain ourselves to you.

55.speaker: Wyll
55.text: Your actions in the grove were indefensible. But Karlach seeks only to drive a deeper wedge between us than already exists.

156.speaker: Karlach
156.text: This is cute. I'm still going to cave your murderous heads in, but it's nice to get a peek at the inside drama first.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: Some paladins of Tyr want you dead. We were thinking we'd oblige them.

212.speaker: Karlach
212.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

145.speaker: Karlach
145.text: I think I told you to get the fuck out of my face, for your own good.

214.speaker: Karlach
214.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Karlach is crouched, head in hands, breathing heavily, surrounded by flames, burning.NodeContext: A sound that could be mistaken for a fire building within her, or consuming her from within

113.speaker: Wyll
113.text: One horn. The stink of Avernus. Advocatus diaboli.

269.speaker: Karlach
269.text: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.
269.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Karlach looks to Wyll, smiles, and stands, but she is still aflame

53.speaker: Player
53.text: You're the devil we've been hunting. Karlach, right?

255.speaker: Karlach
255.text: Bloody right. An honour to be chased by the Blade of Frontiers. But - agh!
255.context: NodeContext: A bit of sarcasm. It's not an honour. Not too malicious though. She doesn't hate Wyll, just isn't impressed by him.

242.speaker: Player
242.text: Tell me, monster - what's it like to know you're about to die?

200.speaker: Karlach
200.text: Touch me and you'll regret it.
200.context: NodeContext: Jocular in tone. It's a threat, but she's not mean-mugging. She wants a chance to explain herself before the player starts attacking.

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *A great heat roars through you; her heat, fiery as the Hells.*
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

162.speaker: Narrator
162.text: *Then you're lost in visions of demonic armies as you tear through a landscape of fire and blood.*
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

193.speaker: Narrator
193.text: *The Blood War. You saw it from above as the nautiloid passed through Avernus - this woman was on the frontline.*
193.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

136.speaker: Wyll
136.text: Evidence. Proof that you're a devil, a gladiator in the archdevil Zariel's army.

218.speaker: Karlach
218.text: I can explain. But it's a whole situation. If you'd just hear me out -

197.speaker: Narrator
197.text: *Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
197.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *Her rage and desperation seep into you. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

183.speaker: Wyll
183.text: She's trying to trick us. Don't believe her lies.
183.context: NodeContext: Questioning himself. He has learned the 'monster' he hunts is a victim, but he still ready to attack

211.speaker: Karlach
211.text: You saw the truth. I never wanted to serve Zariel. I was enlisted in her army against my will. Forced to fight, and fight I did.

203.speaker: Karlach
203.text: When I saw an opportunity to get away, I took it. I'm finally home - or near it, anyway.

96.speaker: Wyll
96.text: You served her. That's enough to damn you.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Stand down, Wyll. You saw what I saw.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Be practical. She's infected, same as us - and powerful, too. We can use her as an ally.

114.speaker: Narrator
114.text: *Wyll catches his breath, and his lips straighten. Sheer dread twists his face.*
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll catches his breath, and his face hardens. Signs of worry, fear - even sheer dread.

228.speaker: Wyll
228.text: You don't know what you're saying. You're asking me to trust a devil.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: Gods, you're stubborn. Karlach's not a devil, and you know it.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: Listen to sense, now. I don't want this to end badly for either of us.

232.speaker: Karlach
232.text: You know monsters, right? Better than anyone. Look into my eyes. Can't you see I'm not what you think?

64.speaker: Wyll
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) There's a pause, and then Wyll swears. He realises he has resigned himself to becoming a devil himself. He's upset - but he knows he did the right thing.

165.speaker: Wyll
165.text: You really are no devil, are you? I've... I've been deceived.

182.speaker: Karlach
182.text: Thank the gods. Thought I was going to have to take your head.
182.context: NodeContext: Relieved Wyll is seeing sense. Calming down from her anger.

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: You would've died in the attempt. But - there have been enough threats today.

238.speaker: Karlach
238.context: NodeContext: A little bit of uncertainty, hoping Wyll is calming down

17.speaker: Wyll
17.context: NodeContext: Resigned to his fate but knows he's making the right decision in not attacking Karlach.

112.speaker: Karlach
112.text: I'm Karlach - but you already knew that. And you are...?

141.speaker: Karlach
141.text: Well met, soldier. Nice to meet a friendly around here - it's been tough going so far.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: I may not be a devil, but I can put the Blade's reputation to work.

124.speaker: Karlach
124.text: How would you feel about helping me kill some evil bastards?

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I'm your ticket to curing that tadpole - eventually.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: Really now? First I catch a ride out of Avernus, then I stumble into a friend. Who's the goddess of luck again? I owe her a flower.

168.speaker: Karlach
168.text: Now that we're old pals, how would you feel about helping me kill some evil bastards?

230.speaker: Player
230.text: I'm not interested in making friends.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: Oh boy, an arsehole! I've already won the Blade of Frontiers over; hope you'll prove more of a challenge.

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: You've stayed my blade. Friendship? Don't push it.
98.context: NodeContext: Grim; he's going to pay a huge price for this.

107.speaker: Karlach
107.text: Fair enough. Let me try again, with a little fun thrown in. How'd you like to help me kill some evil bastards?

260.speaker: Karlach
260.text: A little background, if your moral compass needs something to point at...
260.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

161.speaker: Karlach
161.text: You already know I fought in the Blood War. I was good. Really good.
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision that shows Karlach in action. Karlach speaks over the shots. (We’ll reuse this for her origin intro then)

187.speaker: Karlach
187.text: Turns out I've got a knack for killing demons. That made me a valuable asset. Zariel - the archdevil herself - made me as her personal attack dog.

144.speaker: Karlach
144.text: I played along until I could get the fuck out of there, but devils don't like to lose their assets.

46.speaker: Karlach
46.text: Zariel liked it so little, she sent a bunch of goons, so-called 'Paladins of Tyr', to take me back. Problem is, I'm not going.

268.speaker: Player
268.text: Let's send them back where they came from.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.

137.speaker: Karlach
137.text: Then we can work on evicting this parasite and take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

159.speaker: Shadowheart
159.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
13.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
8.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

125.speaker: Karlach
125.text: I'd hug you if it wouldn't scorch your skin off.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Hang on - I said I'd help you, not team up with you long-term.

83.speaker: Karlach
83.text: Trust me - when you see what I'm capable of, you won't regret it.

191.speaker: Lae'zel
191.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: So you want me to kill the people hunting you?

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: Don't worry, I'll lead the charge. But I could use your help. There's a lot of them and only one of me. After that, we can team up. Take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

103.speaker: Shadowheart
103.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
108.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I have good news for you. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.

102.speaker: Karlach
102.text: That's incredible! In that case, you ought to let me return the favour. My muscle for your aid in my battle against the powers of the arch-bitch.

189.speaker: Karlach
189.context: NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

140.speaker: Karlach
140.text: Why don't you clear things with your leader before we team up. Send 'em my way so we can work out the particulars.

192.speaker: Karlach
192.text: If there's one thing Zariel taught me, it's not to fuck with the top dog until it's absolutely necessary.

264.speaker: Karlach
264.text: No room in your party. What should I do?

248.speaker: Karlach
248.text: All right - I'll catch up with you later. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me - got it?

196.speaker: Karlach
196.text: I'll catch up with you when it's time to camp, for now. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me - got it?

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Take Astarion's place - he can head back to camp.

258.speaker: Narrator
258.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

171.speaker: Astarion
171.text: I would object, but sitting by the fire while you do all the hard work sounds marvellous, actually.
171.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Gale could do with a rest.

132.speaker: Gale
132.text: Keeping your greatest weapon in reserve, eh? An excellent strategy.

135.speaker: Jaheira
135.text: Well. I know when I'm not wanted.
135.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

204.speaker: Shadowheart
204.text: If you insist. Don't have all the fun without me.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You can trade places with Wyll.

172.speaker: Wyll
172.text: All right. I know a shortcut.

163.speaker: Halsin
163.text: I shall be waiting. Come find me when you need me.

95.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
95.text: I will wait in camp. Patiently, even.

31.speaker: Karlach
31.text: Hang on, though - looks like you've got enough backup at your side. Not sure there's room for me.

97.speaker: Karlach
97.text: Phew, I'm getting all het up. Let's make tracks!

149.speaker: Player
149.text: I have good news for you. I already took care of the paladins you say were hunting you.

121.speaker: Karlach
121.text: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Why should I do your dirty work?

101.speaker: Karlach
101.text: Dirty work's the only kind I like. Gets even messier the more bodies you throw at it. Think of the potential.
101.context: NodeContext: Some light flirtation in her voice.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I don't think so - you'll have to go it alone.

240.speaker: Karlach
240.text: Damn. After a decade in hell, I was hoping for a little company. Especially some who looked like you.

225.speaker: Karlach
225.text: But I can take a hint. Good luck out there. You're gonna need it.

188.speaker: Gale
188.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
188.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

247.speaker: Player
247.text: Why should I do your dirty work?

99.speaker: Karlach
99.text: Dirty work's the only kind I like. But there are a lot of them and just the one of me. I'll take point, and you flank 'em.

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
127.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

224.speaker: Gale
224.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
224.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I have good news for you, then. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I have good news for you, then. I already took care of the paladins you say were hunting you.

155.speaker: Karlach
155.text: You did?! That's incredible! You ought to let me return the favour. We can team up - evict this parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: All right - welcome to the team.

167.speaker: Shadowheart
167.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
41.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

184.speaker: Gale
184.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
184.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I have my own problems. I don't need yours.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: I can see that. But look, if we take care of my little problem, we can move on to ours. The tadpole.

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: Kill some fiends, evict a parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

270.speaker: Player
270.text: You saw her thoughts. She poses no danger to the Sword Coast.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: You're right. Cut her down before she causes trouble.

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: It's done, Karlach. By my living soul, you will forever burn.

199.speaker: Karlach
199.text: You know, I could've used a friend. Pity that won't be you.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Looks like you found your mark, Wyll. Let's send your devil back to the Hells.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: The paladins of Tyr sent me for your head. And I mean to take it.

229.speaker: Player
229.text: These are no natural flames - prepare to fight.
